translation.en: [Shawn Mendes] You first get on the stage, and ego comes rushing in.
translation.ko: 처음 무대에 오르면 자존심이 고개를 치켜들죠

translation.en: And it goes, "Don't mess up,
'cause you're the man.
Everyone's saying you're the man, so don't mess up."
So you get to the mic, and your first note is flat. [chuckles] Always.
translation.ko: 그리고 마이크를 잡으면 첫 음은 플랫이에요, 항상

translation.en: And then about 30 seconds in, you go...
"Oh, yeah, I'm just a guy and I love music."
And your whole body releases.
And I just let go and I look around, and I'm just like...
"Just do this.
Drop the ego.
Time to surrender."
[automated female voice] Ever since I was about ten years old,
I was obsessed with being really good at things.
translation.ko: 전 뭐든 잘해야 한다는 생각에 집착했어요

translation.en: That my worth is based on what I do.
translation.ko: 제가 하는 일이 제 가치를 결정한다고

translation.en: And that can lead to a dark place.
My voice hit its breaking point at the end of this tour,
translation.ko: 이번 투어의 막바지에 제 목소리가 한계점에 이르렀고

translation.en: -and I'm using my phone to talk. -[playing melody]
Last night reminded me...
I'm not invincible.
Sing!
Louder!
Scream it!
No matter how fast I get, do not stop clapping, all right?
translation.ko: 제가 아무리 빨라져도 계속 손뼉을 쳐요, 알았죠?

translation.en: Here we go! Clap those hands! Clap!
Faster!
Faster!
Faster!
-[man] Hey, uh, good one. -[Shawn] Thank you, brother.
Give us a hug.
-Thank you so much. -[man 1] Let's go. Let's motor up.
-We've got an interview outside. -[man 2] I'm not done with it.
translation.ko: 저쪽에 출구가 있어요 아직 안 끝났어요

translation.en: [woman] You're gonna make a left when you come out
and go through the lights.
-[Shawn] Thank you. Thank you. -[woman 1] Bye!
[woman 2] I love you! I love you!
[man 2] Just keep an eye... I can't see the monitor...
translation.ko: 잘 지켜봐요 저 카메라 화면이 안 보이니까

translation.en: So just keep an eye on the recording.
Hey, Cez, Jocelyn's gonna come. I told her to be here for 11:50.
translation.ko: 케즈, 자슬린이 올 거예요 11시 50분까지 오라고 했어요

translation.en: [man] All right.
[male interviewer] So, this thing you start doing in your bedroom,
making Vines for the love of it...
Is it hard to protect that pure thing that started it all?
[Karen Mendes] Come on, Shawn, let's go! Time to go in!
Get up.
[Shawn] As a kid, when you look at someone and you're like, "This is my dream..."
translation.ko: 어렸을 때 누군가에게 '이게 제 꿈이에요'라고 했는데

translation.en: And someone goes, "That's a stupid dream,"
translation.ko: 그 사람이 그게 한심한 꿈이라고 하면

translation.en: you'd be like, "Oh, yeah, it is a stupid dream."
When I got into school...
Ms. Parker, she was the vocal class teacher,
and I told her, "I want to be a singer.
I want to be... I want to be an artist." You know?
And she had no hesitation to believe me.
My parents, my friends...
Nobody looked at me and said, "You're crazy."
translation.ko: 어느 누구도 절 보면서 미쳤다고 하지 않았어요

translation.en: Everybody was like, "Go for it."
[Manny] He sounds better all the time now.
With more practice like he's had...
[Karen] Hey!
-We love you, Shawn Mendes! -I'm excited!
[Manny] This is larger than I thought.
[man] Yeah.
-[man] Can he hear it? -No. No, no. Nothing can be heard.
[Manny] He may not like being filmed. He's saying hello.
-Hi. -[Shawn] He can't be filmed.
-[Manny] This ain't going anywhere. -Okay.
translation.ko: - 공개 안 할 거니까, 걱정 마 - 좋아요

translation.en: Hey, Mom?
What do you say now?
It is nuts.
What, even to go to the bathroom, he has to go with security.
translation.ko: 화장실에 갈 때도 경비원과 같이 가야 하다니

translation.en: [woman] Oh, my God!
Oh, my God!
I love you!
[Manny] Did you see that?
-"I love you"? Holy moly. -[Karen laughs]
[women cheering] Hi!
-You're not embarrassed of what? -I'm nervous now.
translation.ko: 왜? 떨리니? 지금은 떨려요 조금 전까진 안 떨렸어요

translation.en: I wasn't nervous until now.
translation.ko: 지금은 떨려요 조금 전까진 안 떨렸어요

translation.en: Can we go back there?
[Manny] Hold on. Stay with me.
-[man] Give it up for Shawn Mendes! -[audience cheering]
Do I have anyone from outside of Ontario?
-Where are you guys from? -Michigan.
Michigan!
Holy...
Crazy.
I think I'd heard A Great Big World, "Say Something" for the first time,
translation.ko: 어 그레이트 빅 월드의 '세이 섬싱'을 처음 들었을 때

translation.en: and I was like, "Wow, that's a really great song."
Googled it...
and one of the first search results was Shawn's cover of the song.
translation.ko: 검색 결과 첫 페이지에 숀의 커버 송이 나오더군요

translation.en: [Gertler] I was taken aback a bit. It was like, "This is really incredible."
Reached out, and we FaceTimed Shawn and his mom.
translation.ko: 연락해서 숀과 그의 어머니와 영상통화를 했죠

translation.en: Immediately, Shawn just starts grilling us with questions
about how the music business works, why he might need a manager.
translation.ko: 음악 업계가 어떻게 돌아가는지 왜 매니저가 필요한지에 대해서요

translation.en: I just said to them, I was honest,
"I don't know everything, but I'm going to sit here
and spend every minute of my time figuring it out with you."
[Shawn] I would always say to him, "I need to get a band
translation.ko: 전 늘 그에게 말했어요 '전 밴드가 필요해요 혼자선 멋진 음악을 못 해요'

translation.en: 'cause I'll sound bad on my own," and he'd say, "No.
translation.ko: '전 밴드가 필요해요 혼자선 멋진 음악을 못 해요' 그는 아니라면서

translation.en: Just get on the stage, just you and the guitar."
Having the confidence
was all based off of those first couple years of performing with just a guitar.
translation.ko: 자신감을 키우기 위해 첫 이삼 년은 기타만 갖고 공연했어요

translation.en: I went from a small bedroom in Pickering
translation.ko: 몇 년 만에 피커링의 작은 침실에서

translation.en: to playing in front of a few thousand people in a couple years.
translation.ko: 수천 명의 관중 앞에서 공연하게 됐어요

translation.en: ♪ With somebody who loves me Yeah ♪
It looks so cool.
This is what it's like filming a documentary.
Here we go.
I'm not ready to give this to Scott.
translation.ko: 이걸 스콧에게 줄 준비가 안 됐어요

translation.en: [man] He's not here.
It all stems from when I met him, and he had these cool sunglasses on.
translation.ko: 스콧과의 만남에서 비롯됐죠 그는 멋진 선글라스를 쓰고 있었고

translation.en: He said, "If you had a number one single, I'll give them to you."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말했어요 '1위 싱글 곡이 생기면' - '이 선글라스를 줄게' - 그래요

translation.en: The first thing we did together went number one.
translation.ko: 그리고 우리가 같이 만든 첫 싱글 곡이 1위에 올랐죠

translation.en: It needs another melody.
Yeah, it's just, like...
How's that?
[Scott] Got it?
In my room, there's this thing
that has the number of shows that we're on and where we are.
translation.ko: 몇 번째 공연인지 어디 있는지를 보여주죠

translation.en: Today it's at number eight, Copenhagen,
and it made me think we're not even close to 100.
But it also said Cologne, not Copenhagen.
translation.ko: 근데 코펜하겐이 아니라 퀼른이라고 적혀 있었어

translation.en: -We're in Cologne. -[Shawn] It said Cologne.
translation.ko: 근데 코펜하겐이 아니라 퀼른이라고 적혀 있었어 퀼른이라고 적혀 있었죠

translation.en: -Actually, it might have said Copenhagen. -[all laughing]
But I want us to always keep in mind that this is very special.
translation.ko: 하지만 우린 매일 밤 이 공연이 특별하단 걸 기억해야 해요

translation.en: I'll say it, I know it'll get annoying,
but it truly is so special. What we get to do is magical.
translation.ko: 이건 정말 특별해요 우리가 하는 건 멋지고

translation.en: Everyone in there, it's their first time seeing it,
every single time.
-No matter if it's show one or show 99. -That's right.
It's their first time seeing it, it's special, so thanks. Let's do it.
translation.ko: 관객들은 처음 보는 거니까 특별하죠 고마워요, 해보죠

translation.en: -Beautiful. -Let's do it.
Everybody jump!
[Shawn] I used to look at so many of my idols and be like, "How can you ever be that?
translation.ko: 제 우상들을 보면서 생각하곤 했죠 '어떻게 저럴 수 있지?'

translation.en: They were born legendary."
That's just not the truth.
[Shawn] People are like, "What would you be doing if this didn't happen?"
translation.ko: 사람들은 묻죠 '이걸 안 한다면 뭘 하겠어요?'

translation.en: I feel puzzled by that question,
because I feel like this is what I was going to do.
translation.ko: 전 이걸 할 운명인 것 같거든요

translation.en: I'm in the Q&A yesterday.
This girl goes, "How do I be a songwriter like you?"
translation.ko: 한 소녀가 묻기를, '어떻게 당신 같은 송라이터가 되죠?'

translation.en: I immediately thought about saying that to my dad,
translation.ko: 그 순간 제가 아버지와 했던 대화가 생각났어요

translation.en: "I wanna be a songwriter." He goes, "Can you write songs?"
translation.ko: 송라이터가 되고 싶댔더니 곡을 쓸 수 있냐고 물으셨죠

translation.en: I said, "I don't know." He goes, "Write one."
I sat in my room and I played guitar for seven hours.
translation.ko: 전 제 방에 앉아서 7시간 동안 기타를 쳤고

translation.en: My hands bled. I'd play again and get better, and I'd practice.
translation.ko: 손에서 피가 났지만 계속 쳐서 나아졌고 끊임없이 연습했죠 모두 올림픽 선수가

translation.en: And I'm not saying everyone has to be so Olympic athlete about it.
translation.ko: 끊임없이 연습했죠 모두 올림픽 선수가 돼야 한다는 건 아니에요

translation.en: I said that to her. I was like, "Stop sitting here thinking about it.
translation.ko: 전 그 소녀에게 말했어요 '생각만 하지 말아요'

translation.en: You are a songwriter. Now, go write songs."
You don't hear songs that say,
"You're just too good to be true. Can't take my eyes off of you."
translation.ko: '당신은 믿기지 않을 만큼 멋져' - '당신한테서 눈을 뗄 수 없어' - 그래요

translation.en: Even, like, those trumpets going... [imitating trumpets]
Like, all that trumpet stuff is really cool, right?
Feels, like, so, like, grandiose.
There's something about that I think about when it comes to the next album.
translation.ko: 다음 앨범에 그런 느낌을 살려볼까 해요

translation.en: Something about, like, that, like...
feeling, that, like, all-around, like, overdose of love.
♪ Here I sleep in London ♪ ♪ 'Cause I could spend A hundred days in-- ♪
Could you go, "Counting back from 100, so I can fall asleep faster"?
translation.ko: 아니면 이건 어때? '100부터 거꾸로 세' '더 빨리 잠들 수 있게'

translation.en: -That's cool. -Yeah.
I was feeling like a...
[Scott] Love the echo after "Hello, hello."
[Scott] ♪ Head down on the pillow ♪
"All I have to do."
[man] Yeah.
It sounds better without.
-[man 1] Without? -[man 2] Sounds better.
Again.
Okay, George, punch me on "Close my eyes".
It's pretty cool,
she rents an apartment in West Village, so we're staying there,
translation.ko: 그녀가 웨스트빌리지에 아파트를 임대해서 함께 지내거든요

translation.en: We wake up in the morning, like, "This is fucked."
And we have to wake up and both separately get in SUVs
to head to the same place.
-[man] Yeah. -It's pretty cool.
I'm like, "I gotta leave at 8:30." She's like, "Me too."
translation.ko: '8시 반에 나가야 해'라고 하면 그녀도 그렇다고 하고 전 좋다고 해요

translation.en: It's almost like living a taste of a normal life
in the least normal-life way.
Getting all my clothes on and running to the café for an Americano.
translation.ko: 옷을 입고 커피숍에 가서 아메리카노를 사면

translation.en: Then you guys pulled up, and I was like, "Right, we're going to work."
translation.ko: 여러분이 나타나고 제가 이러죠 '좋아요, 일하러 가요'

translation.en: -[man] How you doing? -Good, how are you?
We go this way.
So, when I step this way, what do I do with my arm?
translation.ko: 이렇게 할 때 팔은 어떻게 하죠?

translation.en: Boom. So this hand, when you step over... You step over here, boom.
translation.ko: 이렇게요, 한 걸음 가서 이렇게 해요

translation.en: -You look back... -Love that.
-So-- -Okay, got it.
-You're going to the other side. -No.
-All your weight is here. -Yep.
And then, you know about the outside edge...
This side?
[woman] Yeah, making sure that...
Okay. Super cozy.
-Super cozy. -Yeah.
[kisses] I love you.
-Do you know that? -I know.
[man 1] Thank you, everyone, good to go. Places. Let's start rehearsal, please.
translation.ko: 다들 고마워요, 준비됐어요 제 위치로, 리허설을 시작하죠

translation.en: [man 2] We're ready to roll when you folks are ready.
[Shawn] Camila, she was in Fifth Harmony, and we were both opening.
translation.ko: 카밀라는 피프스 하모니 멤버였고 우리 둘 다 오프닝이었죠

translation.en: [chuckles] My very first tour ever.
And she was the act after me.
I was first in the lineup,
with the shortest set, and then they went on.
translation.ko: 가장 짧은 무대였고 다른 가수들이 공연했죠

translation.en: Five years ago, man.
[Cabello] He was so...
super hyper-focused on what he was doing.
I never saw him the whole tour.
translation.ko: 투어 내내 한 번도 못 봤어요

translation.en: He was constantly in and out of his bus, playing guitar, writing songs with Geoff.
translation.ko: 자기 버스를 끊임없이 들락날락하면서 기타를 치고 제프와 곡을 썼죠

translation.en: I thought he was cute, but I was like,
"He's... He's doing other stuff, so whatever."
And then, I guess it must have been about four or five years ago,
we were backstage at this Taylor Swift show.
translation.ko: 테일러 스위프트 공연에서 무대 뒤에 있었는데

translation.en: I went to his dressing room to say hi.
And we, like, started writing this song.
And then after that, we, like, spent a lot of time with each other
translation.ko: 그 후로 그와 함께 많은 시간을 보냈어요

translation.en: because we had the song together
and we did a whole Jingle Ball tour together.
And that's really when the fucking saga started.
I really liked him.
I guess he liked me, but...
I don't really know. [laughs]
[Shawn] For the past four years,
just being friends and not seeing each other very often
to finally being able to be together,
she was always there to look out for me as a human being.
translation.ko: 그녀는 늘 제 곁에서 절 돌봐줬어요

translation.en: She's got my back, and I think that's what your partner's for.
translation.ko: 제게 힘이 되어 주죠 파트너란 그런 거잖아요

translation.en: We're in New York, and my song comes on the radio or something,
translation.ko: 우린 뉴욕에 있었는데 라디오에서 제 노래가 나왔고

translation.en: and the fact comes up that it's about her.
translation.ko: 그게 그녀에 관한 노래라는 얘기가 나왔죠

translation.en: And I'm like, "Yeah, it's about you. Everything's about you.
translation.ko: 전 '그래, 너에 관한 거야 모든 곡이 너에 관한 거야'

translation.en: They've always been about you."
She goes, "What do you mean?" I'm like, "They're all about you.
translation.ko: 무슨 뜻이냐길래 이렇게 말했죠 '모두 너에 관한 거였어'

translation.en: Like, every song I ever wrote."
And I'm rhyming off the songs like, "Treat You Better," all these songs.
translation.ko: '트리트 유 베터'나 다른 곡들 제목을 댔죠

translation.en: She's like, "Oh, my God." She literally had no idea.
This whole time, I thought she, like, knew.
translation.ko: 그때까지 전 그녀가 아는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: I don't think I'll be able to write songs that really do it justice,
translation.ko: 제 마음을 제대로 표현할 곡을 쓸 수 없을 것 같아요

translation.en: that can really capture the things and the feelings with her.
translation.ko: 그녀에 대한 감정을 정확히 담아낼 수 있는 곡요

translation.en: I think it's like when you see a moon or stars
and you try to take a photo of it with your iPhone,
and then you just can't, it just doesn't look good.
And you're like, "It's not supposed to be captured." You know?
translation.ko: 그런 건 카메라에 담으면 안 돼요 아시겠어요?

translation.en: It's just supposed to be for us.
[Cabello] Want to do it again for fun, stuff like that?
translation.ko: - 재미 삼아 다시 해볼래? - 그래 하지만 그런 걸 해봐 긴장도 풀 겸

translation.en: Play around just to get loose.
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 걸 해봐 긴장도 풀 겸

translation.en: -Yeah, yeah. -Yeah, yeah.
Okay. Good. Let's sing another song.
What's a song for fun? Literally, any song, but ours.
translation.ko: 뭐가 좋을까? 우리 노래 말고 어떤 거든

translation.en: Shawn! Shawn, right here for me, man. Shawn!
Shawn, right here!
Shawn, one more here.
Oh, my God!
[man] It's insane. That was insane!
That was a really calm red carpet.
[laughs] I'm serious.
-[man] That was calm? -That was calm, dude.
[Cabello] Wait, my, uh... My shoe! My shoe!
Oh, no!
My shoe.
[Shawn] Is there a proper way to do this? I swear, I'm gonna tie a double knot.
translation.ko: 제대로 하는 방법이 있나요? 맞아요, 이중 매듭으로 묶어야 해요

translation.en: [woman] Who's ready?
Can I have water?
Come on, it's time, let's go.
[Shawn] At this moment in time, during the summer of whatever you want to name this summer,
translation.ko: 지금 이 순간, 여름 동안 이 여름에 어떤 이름을 붙이더라도

translation.en: during "Señorita" and "If I Can't Have You"...
translation.ko: '세뇨리타'와 '이프 아이 캔트 해브 유'를 부를 때…

translation.en: Camila and I are staying in an apartment in NYC
translation.ko: 카밀라와 전 뉴욕의 한 아파트에 살아요

translation.en: for the very first time alone.
And making eggs and trying to figure out how to use a Keurig.
translation.ko: 달걀 요리도 해 먹고 커피메이커 사용법도 익히면서요

translation.en: Normal things, you know?
This is really cool, to just be, like, a 21-year-old guy.
And getting older...
That's happening for me too.
[man] Give it up for Shawn Mendes!
Camila Cabello, everybody!
[Shawn] I'm nervous.
Yeah, I feel anxious to go home right now.
[man] How long has it been?
Three and half months.
It's a long time.
I'm excited to have a couple days off and be with friends and family.
translation.ko: 며칠 쉬면서 친구들, 가족과 지낼 생각에 너무 설레요

translation.en: Yeah. So excited.
I'm so lucky to have a friend like Brian.
translation.ko: 브라이언 같은 친구가 있어서 정말 다행이에요

translation.en: He loves them anyway.
He works hard at keeping me in the real world.
translation.ko: 브라이언은 제가 현실감을 잊지 않게 도와줘요

translation.en: If we had our own FIFA cards, you'd probably have--
translation.ko: 상관없어, 우리만의 FIFA 카드가 있다면 넌 아마…

translation.en: -I'd have a high rating. -You'd probably be 76 passing,
translation.ko: 높은 점수를 받겠지 넌 76점, 난 82점을 받을 거야

translation.en: -I'd be 82. -Not a chance.
-I'd be rated a 93, you'd be rated an 87. -[snorts, laughs]
What's Ronaldo?
Ronaldo? I think Ronaldo's a 94.
-Yeah, I'm a 93. -[both laugh]
Without him, I don't know, I'd probably be, like, pretty crazy.
translation.ko: 브라이언이 없으면 전 아마 망나니가 될 거예요

translation.en: Can you match my tone? That's my question.
translation.ko: 내 음정에 맞출 수 있어? 그걸 물은 거야

translation.en: [flatly] ♪ Yeah ♪
♪ Yeah ♪
♪ Yeah ♪
[Shawn] He just connects me with friends from home.
I'm probably closer with my friends from home now than ever.
translation.ko: 전 지금 어느 때보다 고향 친구들과 가까워요

translation.en: -Oh! -They were all supporting me
from the first time "Life of the Party" came out,
and now we're here together.
I want them to look around and be proud of it
and be like, "This is just as much ours as it is his."
"Look, guys, we made it.
How beautiful is this?"
All right, bedroom. You did me great. Thanks.
I'll see you next time.
Thank God I'm leaving you.
Double guitar.
Let's go, bro.
Good to see you, man.
-Good to see you, welcome back. -Thank you.
You rock! You rock! You rock!
Welcome.
-It's been unlocked for three months. -[Brian laughs]
translation.ko: 석 달간 안 잠겨 있었나 봐요

translation.en: Let's go.
Welcome to my cozy house! It smells great in here.
translation.ko: 아늑한 우리 집! 좋은 냄새가 나요

translation.en: Okay, everything seems right.
How's your room, Brian? Seems right?
[Brian] Checks out.
[Shawn] Everything checks out?
[Brian] Oh, yeah.
An alarm!
Wow, the worst shit. [laughs]
Hasn't been home for so long.
[Shawn] This view is, like, the best view I have ever seen in Toronto.
translation.ko: 이 경치는 토론토에서 본 최고의 경치예요

translation.en: Except for them building this gross thing. What is that?
translation.ko: 새로 짓는 저 흉측한 건물만 빼고 뭘 짓는 거지?

translation.en: Oh, my God, they're building a mall or something.
This is pretty cool, eh? Rogers Centre?
[Brian] You can see it from here.
You can see the Rogers Centre from my apartment.
I can see it from my bedroom window when I wake up in the morning.
translation.ko: 제 침실 창문에서 보여요 아침에 일어나면요

translation.en: That's kind of insane to think about that I'm playing there.
translation.ko: 저기서 공연을 하다니 믿을 수가 없어요

translation.en: Damn.
[Shawn] Hello, Mom.
-How's it going? -Good, we're just headed down.
Okay, I'm just trying to... 'Cause I spoke to Amy,
the coordinator following you, but she wasn't sure
if you were going to Whitby to get Aaliyah.
translation.ko: 네가 알리야를 데리러 휘트비로 갈 건지 궁금하대

translation.en: I'm headed to pick her up. I'm 30 minutes from her.
translation.ko: 네, 지금 데리러 가요 30분 후면 도착해요

translation.en: All right, babe. See you soon.
What up!
Hey.
-My daughter's a big fan of yours. -[laughs]
You wanna flip that on selfie mode?
Tell your daughter hi.
-Can you say hi? Her name is Berina. -Berina, I love you.
translation.ko: 직접 인사해줄래요? 이름은 베리나예요 베리나, 사랑해

translation.en: -Thanks, buddy. -Yeah, man.
Canadian love right there.
Hello.
You had a first day of school today. That's why you're in your outfit.
translation.ko: 오늘 학교 첫날이었지? - 응 - 그래서 교복을 입었구나

translation.en: -I like wearing this all the time. -I didn't think about it.
translation.ko: 그냥 시도 때도 없이 입어 알아, 그 생각은 못 했어

translation.en: Look at this shit.
Man, this is our... This is our field.
Brian and I fully, 100% climbed up that.
Swear to God.
He told you?
This is our turf, man. The turf we talked about.
-[man chuckles] -Like, this is where we grew up.
That's why when we talk about Pickering, we're obsessed with it.
translation.ko: 그래서 피커링 얘기를 할 때 집착하는 거예요

translation.en: Look at this.
-[man] Yo. -Look, I brought Tainy to the turf, bro.
-No! What? -[chuckles]
Wow.
How is it?
It's fucking great, man.
-Man, I should've came. -I know.
Wow, looks amazing.
Dude, it's incredible here right now.
[Aaliyah] When he started singing, he wasn't the greatest.
translation.ko: 오빠가 노래를 시작했을 땐 솔직히 별로였어요

translation.en: I was like, "Let's see where this goes."
It was just constant noise at my house. So annoying.
translation.ko: 우리 집엔 소음이 멈추지 않았어요 너무 짜증스러웠죠

translation.en: Like, it was awful.
I asked him if he wanted to be famous one day,
and he, like, shut the whole idea down so fast.
He was like, "No, I don't want to be famous. It seems awful."
translation.ko: '아니, 유명해지기 싫어 끔찍할 것 같아'라고 했죠

translation.en: I don't know if he remembers that, but I remember that like it was yesterday.
translation.ko: 오빠가 기억하는지 모르겠지만 전 생생히 기억나요

translation.en: I remember I asked you when you first started singing
if you wanted to become famous,
and you, like, were disgusted by the idea.
-I was? -Yeah.
You were like, "No, I would never wanna be famous,
translation.ko: 오빤 '아니, 난 절대 유명해지고 싶지 않아'

translation.en: like, that lifestyle."
-Probably. -I remember you saying that.
You said it all the time.
'Cause... Obviously, you got good, and you started getting noticed,
so I was like, "You're gonna become famous."
You were, like, "I don't wanna be famous."
translation.ko: 그래도 오빤 이랬어 - '난 유명해지기 싫어' - 기억 안 나는데

translation.en: I don't remember that.
We talked about it all the time in the office.
translation.ko: 난 기억나, 우린 사무실에서 늘 그 얘기를 했었어

translation.en: Well, I obviously changed my mind.
I used to...
This door here...
We'd finish school off...
and everyone would come rushing down
and just hang outside on this front thing on a Friday.
Two hundred people hanging out here, trying to figure out the plans for Friday.
translation.ko: 200명이 여기에 모여서 금요일 계획을 세우곤 했었지

translation.en: -It was so good. -We don't do that.
translation.ko: - 너무 좋았어 - 정말? 우린 안 그래 다들 그랬어

translation.en: Welcome home, guys.
-[Aaliyah] I got to do homework. -[both chuckle]
[Shawn] Guys, welcome.
This is my home! [chuckles]
Oh, my God.
So stupid.
So stupid.
The biggest plaque you've ever seen.
translation.ko: 이렇게 큰 명판은 처음 보셨을 거예요

translation.en: I've, like, been in every bedroom, but this is my bedroom. Welcome. [laughs]
translation.ko: 여러 침실에서 자봤지만 이게 제 침실이에요, 환영해요

translation.en: This is the room I recorded all the Vines and stuff in.
translation.ko: 이 방에서 바인 동영상을 찍곤 했었죠

translation.en: Pretty small in here, right?
This is it, bro.
This pillow is... Fuck.
They smell good.
Whoa. That was actually really overwhelming. [chuckles]
Mom, I feel like I kind of live here again.
-[Karen] He only comes here to eat. -Not true.
translation.ko: 얜 집에 먹으러 와요 그렇지 않아요

translation.en: -Yes, you do. -What is this?
Every time you walk in you're hungry.
Look at this. Look at this sweater.
-It's Camila. -Oh, my God.
-My girlfriend. Do you know about her? -No, I don't, Shawn.
translation.ko: 제 여자친구예요 카밀라에 대해 아세요? 아니, 몰라

translation.en: You make more money than all of us,
translation.ko: 넌 우리보다 돈을 많이 버는데 공짜로 먹으러 오냐?

translation.en: -and you come here to eat for free? -Oh, yeah.
translation.ko: 넌 우리보다 돈을 많이 버는데 공짜로 먹으러 오냐? 네

translation.en: -[in Portuguese] How are you? -[in English] Hey, buddy.
It's crazy. This is the most time
translation.ko: 황당한 게 뭔지 아세요? 1년 동안 이렇게 오래

translation.en: I've spent at home in, like, a year, probably,
translation.ko: 집에서 지냈던 적이 없었던 것 같아요

translation.en: in the last three days, right?
-For sure. -Every time he comes,
translation.ko: 확실해요 너무 좋아요, 얘가 올 때마다 더 있게 하려고 하죠

translation.en: I try to get him to stay.
translation.ko: 너무 좋아요, 얘가 올 때마다 더 있게 하려고 하죠

translation.en: And you actually got to relax.
Usually, he comes in and eats, says, "I'm not staying long."
translation.ko: - 맞아요 - 집에 오면 먹고 이러죠 '엄마, 오래 못 있어요'

translation.en: We might get him to watch a movie. That's it.
Christmas Eve, he stays.
He spends the night to wait for Santa Claus with Aaliyah.
translation.ko: 그땐 집에 있어요 알리야랑 산타클로스를 기다리니까요

translation.en: -That's right. -Then they get up in the morning,
and Santa Claus has left all the gifts under the tree.
translation.ko: 산타클로스가 트리 아래에 선물을 잔뜩 두고 갔죠

translation.en: -Isn't that right? -She doesn't drop it.
translation.ko: - 그렇지 않니? - 아직도 이 얘기를 하세요

translation.en: -No. -Santa Claus is real.
-Yeah. -Right?
-If you believe it. -I believe.
Yeah, that's it.
-You went to the stadium today? -[Manny] I went yesterday.
translation.ko: 오늘 경기장에 가셨어요? 아니, 어제 갔었어

translation.en: -It's big in there. -It's massive.
I don't want to see anything until I walk in tomorrow.
translation.ko: 내일 가서 보려고 아무것도 안 봤어요

translation.en: -I'm gonna be there tomorrow. -What time?
translation.ko: - 나도 내일 갈 거야 - 몇 시예요?

translation.en: -Probably around noon. -Around noon?
In time for catering, that's why I'll be there.
-[laughs] -Good, good, good. Smart guy.
This is, like, something else too.
I wrote this in the green room the other day.
No lyrics.
I want to write a song that's orchestra heaven, massive drums, and... [imitates buzzing drum]
translation.ko: 오케스트라 천국 같아요 웅장한 드럼 소리가…

translation.en: And then really quiet, my vocal just goes...
My car is driving itself right now.
[Shawn] Yesterday we were watching videos of us when we were, like, 16.
translation.ko: 어제 우리가 16살 때 찍은 동영상을 봤는데

translation.en: We both got so caught up in it.
We looked at each other and were like, "I don't feel good."
'Cause we were taken right back to that insecure, unsure 15-year-old.
And I just felt like, "Wow, she really understands that feeling."
translation.ko: 그때 그녀가 그 감정을 이해한다는 걸 느꼈어요

translation.en: We looked at each other and said, "We feel weird right now, huh?"
And she's like, "Yeah, we do."
And I'm like, "I'm so happy you know why,
translation.ko: 전 말했어요 '네가 그 이유를 알아서 기뻐'

translation.en: 'cause I don't know if I could explain this well to others."
Sounds like your heart.
Feels like my heart, yeah.
Yeah, I went through a phase where I used to write this over and over.
translation.ko: 한때 이걸 반복해서 쓰던 시기가 있었어

translation.en: "I control my brain with my voice."
"I sing with no tension."
"My chest voice is strong and healthy."
This was...
two weeks before we put Rogers Centre on sale, November 24th, 2018.
I wrote... "Here we go. I will sell out the Rogers Centre."
translation.ko: 이렇게 썼어, '시작이다' '로저스 센터 매진을 달성할 거야'

translation.en: I remember I was in this condo.
-And on November 28th... 25th, 2018. -You wrote...
-[both] "I sold out the Rogers Centre." -[chuckles]
translation.ko: - '로저스 센터 매진 달성' - '로저스 센터 매진 달성'

translation.en: That's why it worked. I wrote it in my manifestation journal.
translation.ko: 그래서 매진됐던 거야 내 긍정 세뇌 일기에 썼으니까

translation.en: -Yeah, it was persistent. -This is persistency right here.
[man] You did that thing where you're...
[Shawn] I think Rogers Centre was always a goal of mine.
'Cause when I started playing music, I'd drive by it every day
translation.ko: 음악을 시작했을 때 매일 거길 지나다녔고

translation.en: and say, "I'm gonna play there one day."
Jesus Christ.
-[man] Whoo! Yeah, man! -[both laugh]
[Shawn] Oh, my God!
What is going on?
I don't even know what to look at.
-Where's the stage? -[man] There.
[chuckles] This is crazy.
It's kind of big.
This is insane!
The stage feels small.
Does the stage look small here?
Does the stage feel small? I know I can't put a new stage in, but...
translation.ko: 무대가 작지 않아요? 무대를 새로 만들 순 없지만…

translation.en: -Brother, look what you did. -[laughs]
I walked on, immediately I was like, "Is the stage small?"
translation.ko: 알아요, 올라온 즉시 무대가 작다고 느꼈죠

translation.en: -Just take it in. -Actually feels like a city here.
Look at it.
I'm looking at the Rogers Centre, and for the first time I'm getting nervous.
translation.ko: 로저스 센터를 보니까 처음으로 좀 긴장되네요

translation.en: On the street, the coffee guy says he's coming to the show.
translation.ko: 길을 걷고 있는데 커피를 파는 남자가 '내일 당신 공연에 갈게요'

translation.en: My door guy at my condo says, "I'm coming to the show."
This is a real family thing.
This isn't like...
playing your biggest show of all time. It's more like,
translation.ko: 제 평생 최대의 공연일 뿐 아니라

translation.en: "This is incredible. We're in his hometown.
translation.ko: '얼마나 멋진지 봐 그 사람 고향에 왔는데'

translation.en: There's so much love surrounded. He's playing a show.
It's also in the biggest stadium in the country."
I feel crazy. I've never felt like this.
Sing along!
Here we go!
[Shawn] For this whole year and most of your life,
it feels like you've been anticipating a show like this.
You're standing in front of a crowd of 50,000 people.
And it feels completely surreal.
It's like your feet are floating off the ground.
It's kind of pure magic from start to finish.
Everybody all together. Here we go.
I love you so much. Thank you.
[Shawn] I just felt like there was this real sense of love in the room that night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 공연장엔 사랑이 넘쳤던 것 같아요

translation.en: Toronto, I love you so much with all of my heart. Thank you.
Thank you. Thank you so much for having us.
[man] Manny!
I was so mad. I thought you guys left.
Oh, Shawn!
Nothing better than that, Shawn.
-Oh, Shawn, I am so proud of you. -Thank you.
-You know me, I cry a lot. -[laughing]
-[women cheering] -[woman] Shawn!
-Huh? -I have her vocals separate, too,
so we can pull 'em down if we need to.
-It's all over two. -Yeah.
[engineer] The backgrounds right now...
[Shawn] What happens to me when I'm on tour is I get obsessed with chords.
translation.ko: 콘서트 투어를 할 때 전 코드에 집착해요

translation.en: I kept playing this.
Something like that.
-Yeah. -To go from the unison to the harmony,
I'd be like, "Can't do it."
-[chuckling] -I had to repeat it.
Most of the time I have to play the piano part into the track.
translation.ko: 대부분은 피아노 연주를 트랙에 넣어야 해요

translation.en: I might come in there with you 'cause it's fun.
Go again. I'm gonna take a listen for a sec.
'Cause we have this individual line function...
Yeah.
[Shawn] And we're missing the...
-Is anyone doing that note? -♪ Ooh ♪
You are?
-Yeah. -You're just quiet in here.
Where are you? We'll just turn you up a little.
Yeah, we need that.
[Shawn] I've definitely always felt the pressure to make music that's
translation.ko: 지난번보다 더 나은 음악을 만들어야 한다는

translation.en: better than what I've done before.
I feel this time around, I'm in the studio...
kind of just being like, "Okay, whatever comes, comes."
We recording, George?
[Shawn] You have to not only accept imperfection but embrace imperfection,
translation.ko: 불완전함을 인정해야 할 뿐 아니라 받아들여야 해요

translation.en: because that imperfection in that moment is what turns into magic in the next.
translation.ko: 그 순간의 불완전함이 나중에 마법으로 변하니까요

translation.en: I wonder what else I can do. [sighs]
translation.ko: 달리 할 수 있는 게 없어요

translation.en: Maybe I'm doing a little too much on stage.
translation.ko: 무대에서 너무 많은 걸 하나 봐요

translation.en: [Cez Darke] Maybe.
Maybe calm down a bit. You've also added another song.
translation.ko: - 그래요 - 좀 진정하는 게 좋겠어 게다가 한 곡을 추가했잖아

translation.en: Two songs.
Two songs, basically.
-And the medley's longer. -Yeah.
So you're working harder.
[raspy voice] London, how you doing?
I'm so sorry, guys. My voice is cutting out on me so much tonight.
translation.ko: 정말 죄송해요, 오늘 밤에 목소리가 잘 안 나오네요

translation.en: I'll need your help as much as I can.
I promise to sing my heart out, but I only got what I got in my voice,
translation.ko: 저도 열심히 부르겠지만 제 목소리엔 한계가 있거든요

translation.en: so thank you so much.
They're looping.
You tell me when you want to go.
-What you just did just then... -No, man, I...
[Shawn] We're on a 104-show tour, and...
half of me right now is like,
"Make sure you say you're grateful," because I am.
In the biggest way, I'm so grateful.
I love these performances. I've never had more fun in my life, but...
translation.ko: 공연하는 걸 좋아하고 이렇게 즐거운 적이 없었지만…

translation.en: I also want to hang with my parents, watch movies.
translation.ko: 부모님과 시간을 보내고 영화도 보고 싶어요

translation.en: You're gonna do a tree at my house?
Yeah. I'll do your tree, but nothing else.
[Shawn] Drive around a suburb, lay on a soccer field...
translation.ko: 교외로 드라이브를 가고 축구장에 누워 있고

translation.en: smoke a joint and stare at the stars with my friends
and, like, eat some beef jerky. [laughs]
And, like, really, like, small-town thoughts.
You know, those things are like...
I think I miss that a little bit right now.
It's pretty intense all the time.
I really think about that a lot.
If I tell the world that I'm just a normal human,
are they going to stop coming to the shows
translation.ko: 더 이상 제 공연에 오지 않고

translation.en: and listening to the music, and, like,
is all the craziness going to stop?
Then you're like, "Maybe I shouldn't tell them.
translation.ko: 그래서 말하면 안 될 것 같고

translation.en: I should keep the trick up.
Maybe I should pretend that I'm Superman for a little bit longer."
translation.ko: 좀 더 슈퍼맨인 척해야 할 것 같아요

translation.en: Just played.
Writing a little message on Instagram.
"Feeling overwhelmed by life today.
I'm right here right now, and it's beautiful.
And it's so beautiful.
And it's so beautiful."
That's all I got for you.
I've been trying to figure it out since it started, you know,
and I have a billion different ways...
People'll be like, "Why'd this happen to you?" I have a lot of logical answers,
translation.ko: 왜 이런 일이 생겼느냐고 물으면 논리적인 대답은 많지만

translation.en: but none of them are satisfying, you know?
I'm constantly warming up,
and I'm constantly checking my voice out of fear of the fact that...
one day I'm going to go to sing and it's going to just not come out.
translation.ko: 어느 날 무대에 섰는데 목소리가 안 나올까 봐요

translation.en: [Vetro] Open the back of your throat, take a deep breath.
translation.ko: 목 뒤쪽을 좀 더 열고 깊게 심호흡해요

translation.en: [Vetro] Really loose and open.
[Shawn] What are they doing?
[man] They're running 'cause they see other people running.
translation.ko: 뛰는 거예요, 남들이 뛰니까 그래도 된다고 생각하는 거죠

translation.en: Dude, the show's gonna be nuts.
They're screaming.
I wonder if the band's out there.
Maybe it's 'cause I just posted the Instagram of the sunset.
translation.ko: 방금 인스타그램에 노을을 올려서 그런가 봐요

translation.en: Doesn't mean that I'm down there.
-Hi. -This experience has been so good.
Oh, my God! Oh, my God!
-I can't speak. -It's okay.
It's so nice to meet you.
Yeah.
You make me feel connected to you and connected to people around me,
translation.ko: 당신, 그리고 주변 사람들과 유대감을 느끼게 해줘요

translation.en: and I'm just so thankful, and I...
-Oh, my God. -[laughs]
Should we take a photo?
[Shawn] When you're pulling up to a hotel in a country you've never been to,
translation.ko: 한 번도 가본 적 없는 나라의 호텔에 도착했는데 밖에서 1,000명이 절 기다리죠

translation.en: and there's 1,000 people outside waiting for you...
no matter how many times you go through that, it feels...
like a dream.
I don't know if that's ever going to feel normal.
translation.ko: 그게 평범하게 느껴질 때가 올지 모르겠어요

translation.en: I don't know if that's supposed to feel normal.
I love you so much, thank you!
Thank you so much!
Thank you, Shawn! I love you!
What's up, guys?
We're, uh... We're in Brazil on the last leg of the tour.
I woke up feeling...
[clears throat] ...pretty sick today.
The day before I'm gonna play two stadiums in São Paulo.
But you know what? It's okay because...
I watched some Kobe Bryant YouTube videos and I feel great.
translation.ko: 코비 브라이언트 유튜브 영상을 봤더니 기분이 좋아요

translation.en: -'Cause I had swelling on my right cord. -Yeah, that's swollen.
Just wanna check. I have volume if I wanna bring it back.
translation.ko: 검사를 받아보려고요 고음을 낼 순 있지만

translation.en: -Okay, you'll just-- -But I just am choosing not to. Yeah.
Yeah.
Thank you so much.
[Vetro] Hey, how's it going?
It's going. It's going.
Just listen to this. This is...
I don't know. It makes me very nervous.
translation.ko: 글쎄요, 많이 안 좋은 것 같군요

translation.en: What time is it there right now?
And what time is the show?
I don't think it's a good idea. That's my feeling.
I want to bring you to Cez,
just so you can say to him, based off of...
You're saying, based off of how my voice sounds--
Based off of that, you shouldn't even be talking.
translation.ko: 숀의 목 상태로는 말을 해서도 안 돼요

translation.en: I'm nervous that you'll hurt yourself, and then...
Can you hear me?
Yeah.
Hey.
Yeah, so we FaceTimed Nasseri in while we were in with the other doc.
translation.ko: 다른 의사한테 진료받을 때 나세리와 영상통화 했어요

translation.en: So he was there looking at all the videos, all the scopes.
translation.ko: 그는 모든 동영상과 모든 영역을 검토봤죠

translation.en: Everything was, like, through him.
Yeah, I completely trust what you're saying, and agree.
The truth is in the singing.
Yeah, a hundred percent. [chuckles]
It's there or it's not. Yeah, totally.
Okay, if you're saying it's detrimental to warm up right now,
translation.ko: 알겠어요, 지금 워밍업하는 게 해가 된다면

translation.en: then let's not do that.
All good. Thanks, Eric.
All right. Bye, dude.
Just so you know, I've made it very aware that we have 11 more shows after this.
If we're in any way pushing through this show to get this show done,
translation.ko: 이 공연을 취소하기 싫어서 무리하게 강행하면

translation.en: it'll be to the detriment of those.
-We'll have to start thinking about-- -The show scenario. Yeah.
translation.ko: 지금 생각해야 할 건… - 공연 시나리오예요 - 그래요

translation.en: Dr. Nasseri, it's Cez here.
I'm going to merge a call with Eric,
and you've got me and Shawn here.
[Vetro] So, Shawn, any improvement yet?
No.
-Five hours to show time, Cez? -Yeah, we're 30 minutes to doors.
translation.ko: 공연 시작 5시간 전이죠? 네, 30분 후에 문을 열어요

translation.en: -Thirty minutes to doors? Why so early? -'Cause it's a stadium.
translation.ko: 30분 후에? 왜 그렇게 빨리 열죠? 경기장이라서요

translation.en: Right.
[Nasseri] I was just gonna say, we've seen people who have said,
translation.ko: 이 말만 하죠 이렇게 말하는 사람들을 봤어요

translation.en: "I'm just going to muscle through it",
and they completely hemorrhaged, and then they needed surgery.
translation.ko: 그러다 성대가 파열돼서 수술을 받아야 했죠

translation.en: I mean, I know it's a really overwhelming thing to cancel, but--
[Vetro] I'm gonna step in now and tell you
you have really no voice, we have 11 shows to go.
For an outside stadium,
you're gonna hurt yourself for the next 11.
translation.ko: 남은 11번의 공연 동안 성대가 손상될 거예요

translation.en: -Yeah. -[Vetro] What do you think, Shawn?
I don't know. I'm not in a good place to make any decisions.
translation.ko: 모르겠어요, 지금 상태론 어떤 결정도 못 내리겠어요

translation.en: [Darke] He's overwhelmed.
And just to be clear, both of you are saying
we should cancel the show, right?
-[Vetro] We're unanimous on that. -[Darke] Okay.
Well, we'll get into it this side, and, um...
Yeah, we'll let you know on the final decision,
and then we'll update you.
-[Vetro] Okay. -All right. Thanks, dudes.
Take care.
See you in a bit, all right?
[in Portuguese] Canceled!
"It breaks my heart to do this,
but my doctors told me I cannot perform tonight,
translation.ko: '제 담당 의사들이 오늘 밤 공연을 하면 안 된대요'

translation.en: or it would risk long-term damage to my voice.
I love you all, and I apologize from the bottom of my heart.
I wish I could be there on stage tonight.
translation.ko: '오늘 밤에 공연할 수 있다면 얼마나 좋을까요'

translation.en: I'll make it up to you the next time I'm there."
-[sighs, sniffles] -[Karen] Aw, babe, I'm sorry.
It was a great show last night.
They got to see you there, babe. It wasn't like...
translation.ko: 팬들은 널 볼 기회가 있었어 네가…

translation.en: you haven't been there. They've seen you.
translation.ko: 안 간 것도 아니잖아 팬들은 널 봤어

translation.en: They've experienced it.
It wasn't like you've never been there.
You told me you were sick. You had a bad voice,
translation.ko: 넌 아프다고 했고 목이 안 좋다고 했지만

translation.en: but you never told me it was that serious.
It's fine. You're fine. It's not the end of the world, babe.
Take a breath.
[whispering] Yeah.
You can't help it.
Love you.
You too, babe. I love you more.
You're good. You've got it.
You've got this, babe.
You know what, the fans are gonna understand.
Yeah, said you were on vocal rest. I didn't realize it was that serious.
translation.ko: 아빠가 네 목 상태가 안 좋댔는데 그렇게 심한 줄 몰랐어

translation.en: [Shawn] It's so hard in that moment to be like, "What can you do?"
translation.ko: 아무것도 할 수 없다는 게 너무 힘들어요

translation.en: because there's 40,000 people outside.
And you just feel...
the deepest pit in your stomach.
Wow, it changes the mood real fast.
[Shawn] When we got to the hotel
and I was up in my room, I was so upset with the situation,
translation.ko: 제 방에 있었는데 그 상황 때문에 너무 속상했었죠

translation.en: and then I heard chanting from outside.
I opened up my window,
and there was 2,000 people in the streets chanting.
And that is, like, beautiful.
Right then, I was like, "I can't even...
I can't even believe how good people are."
translation.ko: 사람들이 얼마나 착한지 믿을 수 없었어요

translation.en: Just a really beautiful thing.
[automated female voice] I was upset for a while.
I sat there in the stadium knowing I was the reason it was all falling apart.
translation.ko: 경기장에 앉아서 저 때문에 공연이 취소됐다는 생각을 했죠

translation.en: The hardest part is feeling like I let them down.
translation.ko: 가장 힘든 건 팬들을 실망시켰다는 거예요

translation.en: These next 10 years are when everything I do is going full speed.
translation.ko: 향후 10년간은 뭘 하든 전력 질주할 거예요

translation.en: It's like an athlete in their prime.
I have to keep going.
[Shawn] The heaviness of the tour
made me want to flip things around and become more positive, you know?
translation.ko: 어려움을 극복하고 긍정적인 생각을 갖게 해줬어요

translation.en: And I'm writing about anxiety more as...
a companion I have to live with
and less of an enemy that I'm trying to resist.
Okay, can we just double that, then?
-Double that, I think it's cool. -Cool.
I'm really excited to sing these songs on tour.
translation.ko: 공연할 때 이 곡들을 부를 생각에 신나요

translation.en: All this stuff is so playable, in the best way.
translation.ko: 가장 멋지게 연주할 수 있는 곡들이죠

translation.en: I want another Juno to come in...
behind it there, like...
And then another third one to come in there,
like, kind of, a little rise.
When you start an album, you don't really know what to expect.
translation.ko: 앨범 작업을 시작할 땐 뭘 기대해야 할지 몰라요

translation.en: So you just have to dive in and see what happens.
Some sort of little thing in the back there.
-You felt that there? -Little pause? Yeah.
translation.ko: - 작은 거 느꼈어요? - 일시 정지? 네

translation.en: Hear it now.
How are the horns sounding right now?
Is this how we always assembled?
-It's our thing. -Okay, cool.
[man 1] Good times.
It's our last show.
-It's our last show. -[man 2] And it's sold out.
Sold out, baby.
Why do you look so cool?
-[Aaliyah] How are you? -Fine!
-Hey! -How you feeling?
-How's it going? -Mom on FaceTime?
-She is. -Hi, Mom!
I'll flip it around.
[Shawn] A hundred and five shows...
The last year of my life has been this tour, and...
it's bittersweet.
It's more sweet than bitter, to be honest.
This makes me so happy, when I come into the venue,
translation.ko: 이걸 보면 너무 행복해요 공연장에 오고

translation.en: and it's been weeks, and all of a sudden,
the "Manny" thing pops up, and I'm like, "He's coming to town."
♪ Ooh, a storm is threatening ♪
♪ My very life today ♪
♪ If I don't get some shelter ♪
♪ Ooh, yeah, I'm gonna fade away ♪
♪ War, children ♪
♪ It's just a shot away ♪
-Hey, bro. -Hey, brother.
[Shawn] At the end of this tour, I'm realizing
this is something I want to do for the rest of my life.
translation.ko: 이건 제가 남은 평생 하고 싶은 거예요

translation.en: How do you get to the end of a very, very intense year...
translation.ko: 아주 강렬했던 한 해의 끝에 도달했는데

translation.en: and want to do it all over again?
At the end of this tour,
I wish I had some profound thing to say about all this, but...
you know what the truth is?
You walk up on the stage and you look around and you think...
"I'm just a guy who really loves music.
Time to let go."
New York!
Let me record that.
♪ The only thing that's on my mind ♪
